NYDIG is a reputable and fully licensed and regulated institutional Bitcoin custodian with a stellar track record. No unusual risks there. There were no real OFAC or AML risks with the product, since it was a closed loop system with no withdrawals. And clearly, banks making it

NYDIGâ€™s program falls into the latter category. The idea was to use bank software providers like Fiserv or Computer Services Inc to give ordinary depositors access to Bitcoin buy/sell via their online or mobile banking portals. It was widely promoted in 2021/22 and was set to go

So under what â€œsafety and soundnessâ€ â€œfinancial stabilityâ€ or â€œconsumer protectionâ€ pretexts were they nixing these crypto products under? None that they had enumerated. The assets werenâ€™t being held by the banks, they were held by NYDIG on behalf of bank clients. So Bitcoinâ€™s

Returning to the NYDIG product again, I think itâ€™s very clear it posed no safety or soundness risks to the banks themselves, and few if any risks to the actual end users, aside from the normal market risk of Bitcoin. But the FDIC doesnâ€™t go around telling banks they canâ€™t let

.@ln_strike is an incredibly easy-to-use, P2P payment app that is built on top of Bitcoin and the Lightning Network. Users can easily send dollars and withdraw bitcoin with Strike and it helped showcase the advances that Bitcoin has made as a payments technology this year.

.@slush_pool is the most innovative public mining pool in the space and in 2020, began championing a Stratum protocol improvement which should significantly improve the incentives between miners and pool operators.

In 2020, @SwanBitcoin established itself as a new and powerful player in the Bitcoin onramp and education space. Swan is a true Bitcoiners onramp that remained true to Bitcoin best practices throughout the year. Swan has a phenomenal team of talented builders and educators.

.@unchainedcap is one of the first Bitcoin-native financial services company. In 2020 it built on its fantastic 2019 momentum by shipping business infrastructure & features, as well as announcing support for Coldcard. Its blog is one of the best educational resources for Bitcoin.

The demand for GBTC has decreased accordingly.

So GBTC started to see a negative premium.

8.

However, many traditional financial institutions are affected by regulation and cannot directly trade BTC.

They can only invest in Bitcoin by buying and selling GBTC.

Therefore, the demand for GBTC in the market is very large, and the price of GBTC will rise accordingly.

4.
